actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Subcommittee on Government Info. And Regulation. Hearings held.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Government Information and Regulation

official_title: A bill to amend the provision of title 5, United States Code, to provide that consultation with the private sector and ensuring practical application of research and development through Federal funds shall be used as criteria in performance appraisals of certain Federal employees, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Federal Employee Technology Transfer Act - Provides that appraisals of performance in the performance management and recognition system and Senior Executive Service for Federal employees involved in the awarding and administration of loans, grants, contracts, or other financial support involving Federal expenditures for research and development shall take into account the extent to which such employees: (1) consult and seek advice from non-governmental persons of relevant industries on Federal expenditures for applicable research and development; and (2) ensure to the greatest extent possible that such expenditures shall have practical application beneficial to the national economy without compromising the mission responsibility of the agency.

titles.title: A bill to amend the provision of title 5, United States Code, to provide that consultation with the private sector and ensuring practical application of research and development through Federal funds shall be used as criteria in performance appraisals of certain Federal employees, and for other purposes.
